perturbation.original_text: 1.3 "Affiliate" means, with respect to a Party, any corporation or other entity that is directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by or under the common control with such Party. For the purpose of this definition, "control" means the direct or indirect ownership of at least fifty percent (50%) of the outstanding shares or other voting rights of the subject entity to elect directors (or, in the case of an entity that is not a corporation, for the election of the corresponding managing authority), or if not meeting the preceding, any entity owned or controlled by or owning or controlling at the maximum control or ownership right permitted in the country where such entity exists.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.3 "Affiliate" means, with respect to a Party, any corporation or other entity that is directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by or under the common control with such Party. For the purpose of this definition, "control" means the direct or indirect ownership of at least twenty-five percent (25%) of the outstanding shares or other voting rights of the subject entity to elect directors (or, in the case of an entity that is not a corporation, for the election of the corresponding managing authority), or if not meeting the preceding, any entity owned or controlled by or owning or controlling at the maximum control or ownership right permitted in the country where such entity exists.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines control as ownership of at least 50% of the outstanding shares, while the modified version defines it as ownership of at least 25% of the outstanding shares. This creates a contradiction regarding the level of ownership required to establish affiliate status.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1 Term. This Agreement begins on the Effective Date and shall continue indefinitely unless sooner terminated as provided in this Article 5.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 Term. This Agreement begins on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of five (5) years, unless sooner terminated as provided in this Article 5.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the agreement continues indefinitely. The modified text states the agreement continues for a period of five years. This contradiction concerns the agreement's lifespan.

perturbation.original_text: 7.8 Assignment. This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of, and shall be binding upon, the Parties and their respective successors and assigns, but neither Party may assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other except to a person into which it has merged or who has otherwise succeeded to all or substantially all of the business and assets of the assignor, and who has assumed in writing or by operation of law its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.8 Assignment. This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of, and shall be binding upon, the Parties and their respective successors and assigns, and either Party may freely assign this Agreement to any third party without the prior written consent of the other.
perturbation.explanation: The original text prohibits assignment without prior written consent, whereas the modified text allows either party to freely assign the agreement to any third party without consent, creating a contradiction regarding assignment rights.
